page.title: 12Resume of Haddenham Shops
page.content: The village of Haddenham is{well {served by shops}and it is quite possible to live comfortably without having to go to a bigger town very often. There are{24 shops, half of which sell {food. Banks Parade}and the shops at {Fort End}are the main shopping centres but the others are fairly evenly spread through the village, with only the big, new Sheerstock housing development being a long way to shops. When new housing development took place between 1964-71 and 1975-81{no {new groups of shops were allowed except for Banks Parade. A study of shopping patterns suggested that{a large proportion of shopping is {done in nearby towns}like Thame or Aylesbury and that extra shopping facilities were unnecessary.
